headline: Don Larsen, 90, Dies; a Burly Yankee Who Pitched the Only Perfect World Series Game
abstract: He retired after 14 seasons with a losing record for his career, but for one day in 1956 he was the picture of perfection.
lead_paragraph: Don Larsen, an otherwise ordinary pitcher who achieved the extraordinary when he threw the only perfect game in World Series history, died on Wednesday in Hayden Lake, Idaho. He was 90.
